Home → Recommendations & reviews → Reviews → Advent calendar 2016

Suffolk Libraries advent calendar 2016

Every day until Christmas Eve a member of Suffolk Libraries reveals a book, album or film they'll be giving as a Christmas present, and why.

December 1

The Secret Diary of Hendrik Groen, 83 ¼, by Anonymous.

Stock team member Jo Dixon recommends The Secret Diary of Hendrik Groen, 83 ¼, by an anonymous Dutch author.

December 2

The Dinosaur That Pooped Christmas, by Tom Fletcher, Dougie Poynter & Garry Parsons

Library and information advisor Emma Maguire recommends The Dinosaur That Pooped Christmas, by Tom Fletcher, Dougie Poynter & Garry Parsons.

December 3

Ten Little Elves, by Michael Brownlow & Simon Rickerty.

Kedington Library manager Dawn Bamford recommends Ten Little Elves, by Michael Brownlow & Simon Rickerty.

December 4

Elf

Elmswell Library manager Emma Yarrow recommends the film Elf.

December 5

Room

Library and information advisor Nilima Banerji recommends the film Room

December 6

The BFG

Bookstart administrator Kate Bacon recommends the film The BFG.

December 7

The Book Thief, by Markus Zusak.

library and information advisor Tanya Collins recommends The Book Thief, by Markus Zusak.

December 8

The Bubble Boy, by Stewart Foster

Libraries innovation and development manager Krystal Vittles recommends The Bubble Boy, by Stewart Foster.

December 9

A Visit From St Nicholas, by Clement C. Moore.

Bury St Edmunds Library assistant manager Gill Turner recommends A Visit From St Nicholas, by Clement C. Moore.

December 10

The Tailor of Gloucester, by Beatrix Potter

Southwold Library manager Charlotte Clark recommends The Tailor of Gloucester, by Beatrix Potter.

December 11

The Polar Express

Gainsborough Library staff member Alison Catchpole recommends The Polar Express.

December 12

Bilbo The Lifeguard Dog: a true story of friendship and heroism, by Steven Jamieson

Bury St Edmunds Library staff member Natasha Catchpole recommends Bilbo The Lifeguard Dog: a true story of friendship and heroism, by Steven Jamieson.

December 13

I'll Be Home For Christmas, by various authors

Library and information advisor Debra Rowe recommends I'll Be Home For Christmas, by various authors.

December 14

Ticket To Ride: Europe

Library and information advisor Andrew Miller recommends the board game Ticket To Ride: Europe, which is available to hire from the branch's Board Games Library.

December 15

A Body in Barcelona, by Jason Webster

Stock team member Jo Dixon recommends A Body in Barcelona, by Jason Webster.

December 16

Mindfulness in Eight Weeks, by Michael Chaskalson

Library and information advisor Helen Kerridge recommends Mindfulness in Eight Weeks, by Michael Chaskalson.

December 17

Fresh India: 130 quick, easy and delicious vegetarian recipes for every day, by Meera Sodha

Leiston Library manager Gayla Rowling recommends Fresh India: 130 quick, easy and delicious vegetarian recipes for every day, by Meera Sodha.

December 18

Elizabeth Is Missing, by Emma Healey

Haverhill Library library and information advisor Audrey Woodley recommends Elizabeth Is Missing, by Emma Healey.

December 19

The Last of the Spirits, by Chris Priestley

Lakenheath Library manager Chris Howard recommends The Last of the Spirits, by Chris Priestley.

December 20

A Place Called Winter, by Patrick Gale

Library and information advisor Theo Clarke recommends A Place Called Winter, by Patrick Gale.

December 21

The Outrun, by Amy Liptrot

Stock and content manager Paul Howarth recommends The Outrun, by Amy Liptrot.

December 22

Tales of Horror and the Supernatural, by Arthur Machen

Deputy head of IT Leon Paternoster recommends Tales of Horror and the Supernatural, by Arthur Machen.

December 23

The Girl With No Name, by Diney Costeloe

Web content editor Alice Violett recommends The Girl With No Name, by Diney Costeloe.

December 24

The Ladybird Book of the Meeting, by Jason Hazeley & Joel Morris

Chief executive officer Alison Wheeler recommends The Ladybird Book of the Meeting, by Jason Hazeley & Joel Morris.
